intro: Phyllotaenium, commonly known as the silver leaf plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plant is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright indirect light. Phyllotaenium is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and air-purifying properties.
